tourBios.curYrHigh: Was the medalist at the Second Global Qualifying Tournament, securing full playing privileges on the PGA TOUR China Series for the entire season. Was par or better in all four rounds, including a final-round 71 at CTS Tycoon GC to defeat Alex Kang and Jung Hwan Lee by a shot…Attended the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament but did not qualify for the finals of that event...In the 36-hole Twin Oaks Shootout on the Golden State Tour, shot rounds of 68-61 to secure the title by finishing at 15-under, five shots ahead of Bryan Martin. During the two-round event, recorded 12 birdies, two eagles and only one bogey.

Was the medalist at the Second Global Qualifying Tournament, securing full playing privileges on the PGA TOUR China Series for the entire season. Was par or better in all four rounds, including a final-round 71 at CTS Tycoon GC to defeat Alex Kang and Jung Hwan Lee by a shot…Attended the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament but did not qualify for the finals of that event...In the 36-hole Twin Oaks Shootout on the Golden State Tour, shot rounds of 68-61 to secure the title by finishing at 15-under, five shots ahead of Bryan Martin. During the two-round event, recorded 12 birdies, two eagles and only one bogey.
tourBios.carHigh: 2014: Finished 14th on the Pepsi Tour money list. Won a pair of one-day tournaments on that circuit in January and February, taking two separate El Prado GC events in Chino, Calif...Also finished second there in mid-January at another 18-hole tournament…Was the runner-up at the eGolf Tour's fifth tournament of the season, at Rustic Canyon GC. Shot rounds of 71-65-66 to finish a stroke behind winner Scott Harrington…Qualified for the California Open, with rounds of 69-71 through the first 36 holes and a 68 in the final round leading to a sixth-place finish. Only a third-round 75 kept him from contending.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played collegiate golf at Chico State in California. On the 18th hole, made a 25-foot birdie putt to get into a playoff at the 2011 NCAA Division II Championship.Went on to win a three-hole playoff at the Robert Trent Jones Golf Trail's Shoals Fighting Joe Course in Florence, Ala., defeating Lynn University's Daniel Young. Earned Chico State Male Athlete of the Year honors in 2011…Was a second-team Ping All-American in 2010 as well as a Ping All-West Region selection. Did not win an event but had top-five finishes in half of his 12 starts.
tourBios.personal: Has been a professional caddie and has worked early morning shifts at Target to, as he says, “make ends meet.”…Has one sister, Raschell. Admires Tiger Woods.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA Tour China Serie was T13th in 2015 at the Lanhai Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T72nd in Scoring Average (Actual) on the PGA Tour China Series.
